fields.summary: Investigate introducing expandos to items on landing pages

comments.body:
Here are some user interface design concepts for tables.

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+table]

Code-wise, I have a working example in the GUI-1521 branch.
There is a bit of reusable code to manage the expando in a directive. A fair amount of tweaking was needed in the table template. In a nutshell, tables now have alternating normal and expando rows. The expando is hidden. A column with the expand/collapse link is added on the far left. The data for the expando is lazy loaded. Row stripping is handled via angular, not strictly CSS as before due to the "double-row" table structure.
This implementation has a short-coming that would crop up with very large numbers of items in the table. The DOM now contains unseen expando rows in the table. That makes for quite a bit larger page size, but it's client-side-generated, so it isn't going over the wire. We should just run some tests with large numbers of a resource with a fairly complicated expando.
The attached screenshot of a diff shows the nature of the additions to the page template.

For more generic key/value pair displays per wireframes, we could add a template in macros.pt
Sounds like you've made great progress, [~dkavanagh]. I think you had an example of your earlier work. Is there an example of your latest work I could look at?

[~lnajjar], I'm wrapping up the scaling group history screen that includes the initial expando implementation. I'll push that code so you can try it out for yourself. My next expando will be to try on the snapshots landing page since a landing page will be a little different in the kinds of data presented.

Cool. Looking forward to the update.

Right now on ASG history, after clicking an expando it takes about 500 msec to see the expanded contents. I think users may expect to see the expanded contents instantly.

Is there some clever way you can provide that for our users?

There are some things we have to deal with in network delays. When there are a lot of history events, the initial table loading takes several seconds. If we included the expando information, that would be even greater. I feel like we need to load the table as quickly as possible and *if* the user clicks an expando, load the additional data. I don't think we want to sacrifice initial loading times to make possible expando viewing faster.
I did modify the code so that if a row is expanded, then closed, it won't have to reload the data if expanded again.
Attached screenshot of volumes expando. Not too bad, but likely needs more work, esp w/ tags, but might wait for new tag editor, or are we simply displaying in a table?

[~dkavanagh]: How will the expando coexist with multi-select checkboxes on landing pages (per GUI-2057)?  Could we move the expando caret to the name/id cell instead of creating a new th/td column for it?

I'm not sure if a separate column matters as much as placement. Looking at the older wireframe, it looks like it's co-located with the checkbox: https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Volumes+Landing
[~jloza], thoughts?

User interface design for expando concepts here: [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Metrics+Landing]

Note: On this page, I believe we can get away with not using select-all check boxes.
I created a story and sub-tasks for implementing expandos for 4.3 GUI-2259
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1719 (which introduces expandos on the volumes landing page) merged.
